p: In conclusion, the present models predict the co-existence of S. frugiperda with stemborer species in maize fields. Spodoptera frugiperda and C. partellus dominate over B. fusca and S. calamistis but without extinction, except that B. fusca seems to be displaced by C. partellus. Therefore, the invasion of S . frugiperda in maize fields in Africa constitutes an additional pest to maize crop that need to be considered within the context of integrated pest management strategy. However, the underpinning mechanisms surrounding the co-existence and possible displacement of other species warrant additional studies.
